content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, 3 x plus 2 y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="f of 1, equals 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the approximation for <math alttext="f of 1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> if Eulerâ€™s method is used, starting at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with two steps of size 0.1 ?

topic.text: 7.5: (BC ONLY) Approximating Solutions Using Euler's Method

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
